com.yantra.api.inv

Interface getResourcePoolCapacity

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.INVApi, YIFApi

    public interface getResourcePoolCapacity

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getResourcePoolCapacity(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getResourcePoolCapacity API gets break-down details (in terms of days) of capacities, consumptions, and availabilities of Resource Pools based on the specified criteria.

    • Method Detail

      • getResourcePoolCapacity

        org.w3c.dom.Document getResourcePoolCapacity(YFSEnvironment env,
                                             org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                      throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                             java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getResourcePoolCapacity API gets break-down details (in terms of days) of capacities, consumptions, and availabilities of Resource Pools based on the specified criteria.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Additional Information:

        Slot Spanning
        If CAPACITY_SLOT_SPANNING_ALLOWED rule is set to Y, then slot spanning will be enabled for resource pools that meet the following criteria:
        • Capacity is maintained at the service resource level
        • Capacity UOM is based on time
        • The service slot group is not hierarchical
        Slot spanning allows availability of a given slot to include its adjacent availability. A slot will span up to a nonworking shift or a consumption.
        For example:
        Slots8 - 1010 - 12
        Shift Working:YY
        The 8 - 10 slot will be available for a total of 4 hours of capacity. This means that starting from 8, a service provider can work from 8 until 12. The consumption placed for this slot will carry into the next slot. So, if a 3 hour appointment is made for the 8 - 10 slot, availability for slot 10 - 12 will be for 1 hour. If there is a slot-based consumption between 10 - 12 for 1 hour and none for the 8 - 10 slot, total availability for the 8 - 10 slot will be 3 hours.

        Spanning Nonworking Shifts
        If a shift is not working, availability for a slot will not span over the nonworking shift. If the SPAN_NONWORKING_MINUTES is set, a nonworking shift will be ignored up to the specified amount of minutes.
        For example:
        Slots8 - 1010 - 12 1 - 3
        Shift Working:YYNY
        If the rule is set to 60, availability for the 10 - 12 slot will include the capacity available from the 1 - 3 slot. A total of 4 hours can be booked for the 10 - 12 slot. The capacity between 12 and 1 will not be included as it is not working. If the gap between 12 and 1 is working and no consumptions exist in that gap, then a total of 5 hours can be booked for the 10 - 12 slot as it is working the hour between slots.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains break-down details of capacities, consumptions, and availabilities of Resource Pools. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
